bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Louis B. Wilson, June 1, 1942

div1.p: Heilbron informs Wilson that she is publishing an article concerning Reed's period of military medical service in Minnesota, and requests permission to quote from Wilson's article on Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Louis B. Wilson, June 1, 1942
div1.opener:
MINNESOTA HISTORICAL SOCIETY
Saint Paul
June 1, 1942
Minnesota History
ARTHUR J. LARSEN, EDITOR
BERTHA L. HEILBRON, ASSISTANT EDITOR
Dr. Louis B. Wilson
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Wilson:
div1.p:
This society is interested in the activities
of Dr. Walter Reed during the two years in the early
1890's that he spent at Fort Snelling and St. Paul. So
far as we have been able to determine, the best source
of information about that period in Dr. Reed's career is
your article in the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings' Bulletin
for December 8, 1937. vol 12 #49

Development of
P. H. in Minnesota

Dr. Reed's biographers barely mention his
activities during these years, and even his son, who was
here with him, remembers little about them. We have,
however, succeeded in obtaining some rather valuable new
material from the War Department.

Since it is so difficult to obtain information
about this period in Dr. Reed's career, we believe it will
be worthwhile to publish a little article about his
residence in Minnesota. May we have your permission to
quote from your article when we publish ours? It occurs
to us also that you might recall some incidents relating
to Dr. Reed that are not mentioned in your article. If so,
would you be willing to put information about them at our
disposal.

Any suggestions that you may be able to make in
this connection will be greatly appreciated by this society.
